outcome_measure: Suicide attempt
outcome_measure_definition: Electronic medical record review, during 1-year followup period following end of treatment
outcome_measure_comments:
Suicide attempt outcome was based on electronic medical record review: "To determine suicide attempts or completions, notes were filtered by the text search “suicid[e]” and all occurrences were manually reviewed"

Other comments:
One participant in sham treatment (arm B) "exhibited emergent homicidal ideation", and one participant in active treatment (arm A) "required hospitalization for suicidality during the follow-up period." Both cases are reflected in % of participants with SAE data element in harms section.
trauma_detail: combat-related, rape/sexual assault, accidents, illness/medical procedure, community/school violence, natural or manmade disasters, terrorism/political violence/forced displacement, other (unspecified childhood trauma, "serious injury, harm, or death you caused to someone else", "other very stressful event/experiences")

outcome_measure: Beck Scale for Suicide Ideation (suicide ideation)
outcome_measure_definition: Endorsement of item 4 and/or item 5 on BSSI
outcome_measure_comments:
There were no suicide attempts during the study period (during treatment) in either treatment group. There was one suicide attempt in Arm B (PCT) during follow-up period, which is not counted as suicide harm (because it did not occur during treatment).

Data provided in Bryan 2016 for additional outcomes in subgroup of participants with active suicide ideation at baseline (RCI for suicide ideation, new-onset suicide ideation,  and severity of suicidal ideation using BSSI) . This data not entered since only for a subgroup or participants.
citation: Resick PA, Wachen JS, Mintz J, et al. A randomized clinical trial of group cognitive processing therapy compared with group present-centered therapy for PTSD among active duty military personnel. J Consult Clin Psychol. 2015 Dec;83(6):1058-68. doi: 10.1037/ccp0000016. PMID: 25939018.

outcome_measure_comments: Suicidal ideation and risk accounted for most of 47 visits to the ER and 31 hospitalizations, 65% of which occurred during post-treatment follow-up
trauma_detail: combat-related, rape/sexual assault, accidents, community/school violence, other (noncombat death)
citation: Resick PA, Wachen JS, Dondanville KA, et al. Effect of group vs individual cognitive processing therapy in active-duty military seeking treatment for posttraumatic stress disorder: a randomized clinical trial. JAMA Psychiatry. 2017 Jan;74(1):28-36.  PMID: 27893032.

outcome_measure: Crisis contact with mental health care
outcome_measure_comments: For combined intervention groups A+B, suicidal ideation was rated before and after each of the first 2 trauma-focused sessions, as well as the week before and week after the 1st trauma-focused session. Pre-post session scores were compared within-group but not between group (no comparison to waitlist [arm C]).
trauma_detail: rape/sexual assault, child sexual abuse, child other abuse, accidents, natural or manmade disasters, other (traumatic psychosis, war, physical abuse)
citation: van den Berg DP, de Bont PA, van der Vleugel BM, et al. Prolonged exposure vs Eye Movement Desensitization and Reprocessing vs waiting list for posttraumatic stress disorder in patients with a psychotic disorder: a randomized clinical trial. JAMA Psychiatry. 2015 Mar;72(3):259-67. doi: 10.1001/jamapsychiatry.2014.2637. PMID: 25607833.
